title: Lost ...and found! Airport documents Ra Ra teddy bear's extraordinary journey home to a four-year-old girl being 1,800 miles behind in Toronto

They couldn't 'bear' to be apart.
One small teddy made the journey of a lifetime last month after it was accidentally left 1,800 miles behind at Toronto Pearson by four-year-old Phoebe Steel.
After discovering the much-loved stuffed toy was not with the family on the airplane, mother, Jen Heuvelmans Steel, messaged staff in a bid to track down Ra Ra the bear.
Four-year-old Phoebe Steel was 'devastated' when she realised the bear was not on the plane
One day later Mrs Steel was informed that the toy, which was given to Phoebe as a baby, had been discovered in lost and found - and it was soon to begin a long journey back to Saskatchewan in Canada.
Staff, who covered the costs to send the bear home, posted on Facebook to document the route.

Ra Ra's journey began in the drawer of a filing cabinet in Toronto and soon proceeded to the security gate where it was sat in a tray and scanned.
Captioning the photo, staff at the airport said: 'Ra Ra woke up in a drawer at the airport, but he was supposed to be on a plane with his family.'
The bear's journey continued onto a moving walkway as it made its way towards its flight along with other passengers.
Posting on Facebook, Ra Ra's journey began in the drawer of a filing cabinet in Toronto Airport
The bear proceeded through the security gate where it was sat in a tray and scanned
Prior to its embankment, Ra Ra stopped off at duty free to try on a Toronto Blue Jays jersey and met some friends.
Staff then flew the bear back to Phoebe along with another toy from the airport who had joined Ra Ra on the three and a half hour flight.
They added: 'Ra Ra had fun at Toronto Pearson, but was happy to head home to his family. Goodbye, Ra Ra!'
Mrs Steel, said: 'Phoebe was absolutely devastated when we learned we had lost Ra Ra.
The bear's journey continued onto a moving walkway as it made its way towards its flight
Prior to its embankment, Ra Ra stopped off at duty free to try on a Toronto Blue Jays jersey
'She had a bit of a meltdown when on the plane. It took a bit to calm her down but we got there.
'When we got him back she was overjoyed and so excited. She has been quite attached to him and has not let him out of her sight.'
'The airport went above and beyond to get Ra Ra back - they have been amazing and so generous.
'They made a little girl so happy and are such kind people.
'I could never express how grateful I am to them.'
